business.headline: Fresh ED summons to Anil Ambani in fraud case after he skips second dateIn a continued push to seek clarity in the ongoing investigation, the ED has served another notice to Anil Ambani.
Sensex, Nifty bounce back after volatile day as markets cheer Bihar winThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 84.11 points to close at 84,562.78, while the NSE Nifty50 added 30.90 points to end at 25,910.05.

Why safety worries are growing for India's top executivesThe report shows that 71% of corporate security chiefs in India believe the risk of violence against chief executives has increased in the last two years, marking the highest level recorded globally.

Using BNPL regularly? Your salary may be hiding an invisible debt trapHaving easy access to credit at the tap of your finger via BNPL feels convenient, but could those small pay-later purchases be quietly building into a debt trap that only shows up on payday?

From SSY to FDs: 3 smart investment schemes every parent should knowPlanning for a child's future requires wise financial choices. From government-backed savings to bank deposits, these three investments offer stability and dependable returns for parents.

Verizon to slash 15% of workforce. What's driving the massive cuts?The telecom giant has been under pressure as rivals AT&T and T-Mobile continue to offer cheaper plans and aggressive promotions, especially during the launch of new iPhone models.

Bars, coins or digital: How Indians are buying gold differently after prices crossed Rs 1 lakhFor the first time, gold breached the psychological barrier of Rs 1 lakh, a milestone that once seemed out of reach. Until that point, conversations around gold were filled with speculation: "Will gold really touch one lakh?" But once that threshold was crossed, the sentiment changed entirely.

Gold, silver dip slightly today. Is the recent rally losing steam?At the time of writing, at 12.00 pm, gold on the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) was slightly down by 0.30%, trading at Rs 1,26,366 per 10 grams. Silver followed a similar trend, falling 0.69% to Rs 1,61,350 per kg.

Pine Labs shares extend rally after strong IPO debut. Details hereThe stock listed at Rs 242 on the Bombay Stock Exchange, which was a 9.5 percent premium to its issue price. It later surged to Rs 283.70, a gain of 28.5 percent from the issue level. Around 12.33 pm, the shares were trading at Rs 257.35, valuing the company at Rs 29,556.63 crore.

Investor who foresaw 2008 US home crisis closes hedge fund. Here's whyThe investor has spent the past year warning about what he sees as bubbles in the market. He has sharply criticised big technology stocks and the boom in artificial intelligence (AI).

Infosys share buyback record date today: What investors should knowInfosys is conducting the buyback through the tender offer route, where it will purchase shares at Rs 1,800 per share. This is more than 18% above the recent market price of around Rs 1,515.

Do taxpayers always get interest on delayed income tax refunds? Find outIf your income tax refund is taking longer than expected, you may wonder whether the tax department must pay you interest for the delay. The law does provide for interest, but not in every situation.

Capillary Technologies IPO Day 1: Check latest GMP and subscription statusCapillary operates in the AI-led SaaS and customer loyalty solutions space, serving more than 410 brands across 47 countries. The company turned profitable in FY25 after two years of losses, reporting Rs 14.15 crore in profit. Revenue increased to Rs 598 crore in FY25.

Pine Labs shares list at 10% premium: Should you hold or book profit now?Pine Labs' better-than-expected debut and strong institutional support boosted early sentiment, but analysts say elevated valuations and intense fintech competition mean investors should balance listing-day gains with disciplined, long-term positioning.

Can a daughter's name be removed from pension records? Government explainsSeveral departments had asked whether a daughter's name should be removed from the family list after an employee retires. To settle the confusion, the DoP&PW issued an Office Memorandum clearly stating that her name must stay in the records.

Adani Group to invest over Rs 1 lakh crore in Andhra Pradesh: ReportSpeaking at a state event on Friday, Karan Adani said the investments are aimed at expanding the conglomerate's infrastructure footprint in the southern state and strengthening its long-term presence in high-growth sectors.

Sagility share price jumps over 6% today. What's driving the rally?Sagility's shares jumped after a large block deal hit the tape, with buyers overpowering supply. The stock's sharp rise suggests traders are betting the stake sale won't derail its near-term momentum.
Pine Labs share price: Stock lists at 10% premium over IPO pricePine Labs shares opened at Rs 242 on the BSE and NSE. The listing performance was slightly better than grey market expectations.

Infosys, TCS, TechM, HCLTech down: Why are IT stocks falling today?At the opening bell, major IT names fell sharply. Infosys dropped 1.91%, Tech Mahindra slipped 0.66%, HCLTech fell 0.29%, and TCS declined 0.36%.

Muthoot Finance share price jumps 10% after Q2 results. Should you buy?Muthoot Finance's strong Q2 results, driven by record AUM and higher profits, pushed the stock up nearly 10%, though analysts warn that rich valuations may limit further upside in the near term.

entertainment.headline: Salman Khan prays for Dharmendra's speedy recovery Salman Khan expressed deep admiration for Dharmendra during a recent event, highlighting the veteran actor's impact on his fitness journey. He even prayed for his speedy recovery.

Kamini Kaushal's special connection with Dharmendra revealed. Details here Kamini Kaushal, who died at the age of 98, had a special connection with Dharmendra. Their first project remained a cherished memory for Dharmendra throughout his career.

Akshay Kumar, Ahmed Khan's BTS moment from Welcome To The Jungle wins the internet Akshay Kumar's fun BTS moment with director Ahmed Khan from 'Welcome To The Jungle' has gone viral, giving fans a lively glimpse of the film's energetic set.

Veteran actor Kamini Kaushal dies at 98 in Mumbai Kamini Kaushal died at her Mumbai home. Her career spanned more than seven decades, with her last on-screen appearance in 2022's 'Laal Singh Chaddha'.

Girija Oak condemns AI-morphed vulgar images after viral saree video Actor Girija Oak has spoken out against AI-generated explicit images of herself that have surfaced online. Noting a rise in her social media popularity, she highlighted her concerns about privacy, digital ethics and the impact on her family.

Suniel Shetty plays Yeda Anna in Welcome to the Jungle, gets to dance in 3 songs Suniel Shetty returns as Yeda Anna in 'Welcome To The Jungle', reuniting with Akshay Kumar and Arshad Warsi. The film is set for completion in early 2026 and features a large ensemble cast.

The Running Man review: A sharp start, a shaky finish for Glenn PowellRelease Date:Fri Nov 14, 2025 'The Running Man', starring Glenn Powell, has a strong premise and stylish world-building, but Edgar Wright's dystopian action thriller falters in the second half and delivers an uneven viewing experience.

Farah Khan Ali slams media focus on Zarine Khan's funeral rites amid family grief Farah Khan Ali, the daughter of late actor Zarine Khan, has voiced concern over public scrutiny of her mother's Hindu cremation. She urged sensitivity and respect for grieving families.

Did Zayn Malik rejoin One Direction after 10-year hiatus? Read here Zayn Malik has quietly rejoined 'One Direction's company, PPM Music Limited, as an Active Director - a decade after leaving the band, sparking fresh speculation of renewed ties among the remaining members following Liam Payne's passing. No musical reunion is, however, confirmed yet.

How Snowdrop exposed Korea's North-South divide through a tragic love story In this week's K-fix, we discuss how Snowdrop isn't just a love story, it's a powerful political K-drama that captures the heartbreak, chaos, and human cost of Korea's North-South divide through a tragic 1980s romance.

Govinda's wife Sunita learnt of hospitalisation from his post-discharge interview Sunita Ahuja clarified Govinda's condition after his hospitalisation, sharing that she was initially unaware of the incident and learnt details through media reports.

HAQ box office Day 7: Yami, Emraan's film earns Rs 14 crore in 1st week Emraan Hashmi and Yami Gautam's film 'HAQ' continues its consistent box office run, nearing the Rs 20 crore milestone after seven days in theatres, with a pivotal weekend ahead.

Lady Gaga on mental health struggle during A Star Is Born: I completely crashed Lady Gaga shared that she was taking lithium while filming 'A Star Is Born', sharing that she eventually "completely crashed" and required psychiatric care amid her Joanne Tour. She also opened up about her hopes for motherhood and her plans to marry longtime partner Michael Polansky.

A Merry Little Ex-Mas review: A Christmas offering that lacks warmth and humourRelease Date:Wed Nov 12, 2025 'A Merry Little Ex-Mas' explores a couple's final Christmas before divorce. Is the film starring Alicia Silverstone and Oliver Hudson, currently streaming on Netflix, worth your time? You can find out here.

Shakira brings kids to Zootopia 2 premiere, reveals their fun cameo roles Shakira made an appearance at the 'Zootopia 2' premiere in Los Angeles with her sons Milan and Sasha. At the red carpet, the singer opened up about their roles in the new Disney film.

'Black Panther' Chadwick Boseman to be honored with Hollywood Walk of Fame star Chadwick Boseman will be felicitated with a star on Hollywood's Walk of Fame on November 20. The late actor is best known as Black Panther in the Marvel Cinematic Universe

Kriti Sanon shares BTS moments with Dhanush ahead of Tere Ishk Mein trailer Kriti Sanon and Dhanush heightened anticipation for 'Tere Ishk Mein' as Kriti shared adorable selfies ahead of the trailer release, instantly sparking fan excitement. With viral songs, behind-the-scenes moments, and strong promotions, the romantic thriller is gearing up for its big November 28 release.

Ranveer Singh calls Deepika his grounding presence, reflects on natural chemistry Ranveer Singh and Deepika Padukone reunited for a new tourism campaign, opening up about their experiences working together and their distinct travel personalities.

Mona Singh recalls asking SRK to leave The Ba***ds set: You cannot be here Mona Singh shared a light-hearted moment from the sets of 'The Ba**ds of Bollywood', where she asked Shah Rukh Khan to leave because she felt too nervous performing in front of him. The recreated 'Duniya Haseeno Ka Mela' song has since gone viral, adding to the buzz around Aryan Khan's directorial debut.

general news.headline: Farsh par is fantastic for Prashant KishorPrashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj being "farsh par" doesn't mean failure. It's the ground where PK can rebuild, reconnect, and reimagine Bihar politics. Keeping the dust of defeat behind, Jan Suraaj now has a foundation of hope, recognition, and the beginnings of a loyal voter base to soar from.

1st Test, Day 1 Live: Rahul and Sundar survive as bad light forces early stumpsIndia (IND) vs South Africa (SA), 1st Test Day 1 Live Score: Bad light has brought an early end to the day's play. Washington Sundar and KL Rahul remained unbeaten, adding 19 runs for the third wicket in 78 deliveries. indai head to stumps at 37 for 1, still trailing South Africa's first innings score of 159 by 122 runs.

Who will be Bihar Chief Minister? JD(U)'s post, now deleted, sparks buzzBihar Chief Minister: Before the elections, while the BJP asserted that it was contesting the Bihar polls under Nitish Kumar's leadership, it never formally announced that he would be back as chief minister.

Omar Abdullah's big loss of face, party loses seat he vacated after state pollsThe National Conference lost Budgam, the seat Chief Minister Omar Abdullah vacated in the 2024 elections after he also won the Ganderbal seat.

XUV 700 loses control on Delhi-Mumbai Expressway, plunges into ditch; 5 deadThe accident occurred around 7 am on Friday near Bhimpura village. The vehicle, registered as MHO3 EL 1388, was travelling from Delhi towards Gujarat when the driver reportedly lost control.

Tagore wanted two stanzas of Vande Mataram, Gandhi compared chant to Allahu AkbarVande Mataram represents the soul of India's freedom struggle. However, its provocative use as a slogan at times made Mahatma Gandhi equate it with Allahu Akbar. Despite the opposition from a section of Muslims, Congress leaders knew there couldn't be a better National Song. It was Rabindranath Tagore who separated two stanzas from the six others, and endorsed it as the National Song.

Video: UP gang-rape survivor jostles with cops, confronts DIG to seek justiceA gang-rape survivor in UP defied police obstruction to meet the DIG, demanding swift arrest of the remaining accused, in a video that has gone viral.

After Bihar blow, Congress wins Telangana's Jubilee Hills bypoll by over 24,000 votesCongress candidate Naveen Yadav V won Telangana's Jubilee Hills bypoll with a 24,729-vote margin, securing 98,988 votes. BRS's Maganti Sunitha Gopinath finished second, while BJP's Deepak Reddy Lankala trailed far behind.

De De Pyaar De 2 review: Bumpy but breezy Bollywood rom-com that does the jobRelease Date:Fri Nov 14, 2025'De De Pyaar De 2' is a fun, breezy rom-com that combines humour, family drama and familiar charm. The casting is awkward, but the film doesn't disappoint.

Bill to end H-1B visa programme soon, says Republican CongresswomanRepublican Congresswoman Marjorie Taylor Greene said she would be introducing a bill to end the H-1B visa programme, claiming US companies were misusing it to replace American workers. Her proposal would phase out the programme, with a temporary 10,000-visa exemption for medical professionals.
Fresh ED summons to Anil Ambani in fraud case after he skips second dateIn a continued push to seek clarity in the ongoing investigation, the ED has served another notice to Anil Ambani.

Astrophotographer captures once-in-a-lifetime photobombing imageMcCarthy's friend's silhouette, captured mid-descent, perfectly contrasts with the vibrant solar background, creating an astonishing juxtaposition of human adventure and cosmic scale.
Veteran actor Kamini Kaushal dies at 98 in MumbaiKamini Kaushal died at her Mumbai home. Her career spanned more than seven decades, with her last on-screen appearance in 2022's 'Laal Singh Chaddha'.
Jailed JDU leader Anant Singh wins Mokama by over 28,000 votesJD(U)'s Anant Singh defeated RJD's Veena Devi by a commanding margin of over 28,000 votes.

95 losses and counting: BJP twists knife into Rahul Gandhi after Bihar landslideBJP is poised for a decisive victory in Bihar with a two-thirds majority. The Congress alleges the Election Commissioner is acting against the people's will, intensifying political tensions.

Why Chirag Paswan is NDA's Ravindra JadejaFinisher Ravindra Jadeja does it with the bat. LJP (RV) leader Chirag Paswan has done it with seats. After the 100% strike rate in the Lok Sabha polls, Chirag Paswan's party is set to deliver a hit in the final overs of the Bihar Election 2025. Leading in 23 seats of the 29 it contested, Chirag's party doesn't just have a good strike rate, it has helped the NDA's tally with vote transfers.

Sudha Murty, Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw dance their hearts out to dhol beats. Video viralA video of Sudha Murty and Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw dancing to dhol beats at a wedding in Bengaluru has gone viral on social media.

Delhi bomber Dr Umar Nabi's Pulwama home blown up by security forcesDNA samples from the Red Fort blast site matched Dr Umar Nabi's mother, confirming his identity as officials linked him to the explosive-laden Hyundai i20 used in Monday's attack.

Six key factors behind NDA's super-show in Bihar electionsMultiple welfare schemes targeted at women and EBC households, along with Nitish Kumar's long-standing focus on women's empowerment, translated into a strong show for the NDA.

Amit Shah forecast 160+, NDA said 'Hold my sattu'Trends show the NDA not just meeting Amit Shah's 160-seat forecast, but racing far beyond it. With leads crossing 186, the alliance appears headed for a mandate stronger than even its own projections.

Goli maaroge mujhe, asks Uber driver as Delhi man pulls out gun during disputeIn the viral video, the driver could be heard asking the passenger why he was showing a gun and whether he intended to shoot him.

Tiger abhi zinda hai: What makes Nitish Kumar such a force at 74Nitish Kumar: Early trends show Nitish Kumar's JD(U) leading in 75 seats. It marks a stunning turnaround for the JD(U), which is battling anti-incumbency after nearly 20 years in power.

Kaantha review: Dulquer Salmaan-Rana Daggubati's period drama soars, then stumblesRelease Date:Fri Nov 14, 2025Kaantha movie review: Director Selvamani Selvaraj's 'Kaantha', starring Rana Daggubati, Dulquer Salmaan, Samuthirakani and Bhagyashri Borse, is a period drama thriller. Powerful performances and excellent making see the film soar, and then plummet when it becomes an investigation drama.

OnePlus 15 review in 9 points: Big performance, bigger battery, but is it enough?The OnePlus 15 is now available for purchase in India, but are you confused about whether it is the ultimate flagship phone that you should buy in 2025? We have made your buying decision easier by summarising our detailed review in 9 points. We talk about its design, gaming performance, display quality, camera experience and more.

sports.headline: Bumrah emulates Dale Steyn with menacing spell against South Africa in Kolkata Jasprit Bumrah delivered a stunning five-wicket haul on Day 1 of the first Test against South Africa at Eden Gardens. Courtesy of his spell, South Africa were bundled out for 159 in their first innings.

Bangladesh hammer Ireland by an innings and 47 runs in Sylhet Bangladesh recorded a dominant win over Ireland inside four days in Sylhet, thanks to Hasan Murad's four wickets and centuries from Mahmudul Hasan Joy and captain Najmul Hossain Shanto. Despite resistance from Andy McBrine and Andy Balbirnie, Ireland fell short by an innings and 47 runs.

Hockey India announce squad for Jr. World Cup 2025, Rohit named captain Hockey India has unveiled the Indian Junior Men's Team for the upcoming FIH Junior World Cup, with defender Rohit named captain. The squad will compete in Pool B, but will miss key forward Araijeet Singh Hundal due to injury.

Tim Southee joins KKR as 3-time champions continue coaching revamp IPL 2026: Kolkata Knight Riders have appointed Tim Southee as their new bowling coach for the next season. The former New Zealand bowler will join a new-look support staff, led by Abhishek Nayar.

Was begging for Mohammed Shami when I was SRH bowling coach: Dale Steyn Dale Steyn said that he was eager to get Mohammed Shami to SRH when he was working as the bowling coach of the franchise. Shami is being linked with a move away from SRH ahead of the IPL 2026 retentions.

Lakshya Sen stuns former world champion Loh Kean Yow to reach Japan Masters semis Lakshya Sen secured a straight-games win over former world champion Loh Kean Yew to advance to the semifinals at the Kumamoto Masters Japan 2025. The Indian shuttler held off a late challenge from Loh, winning 21-13, 21-17 to set up a match against Japan's Kenta Nishimoto.

Bauna bhi hai: Bumrah's LBW chat with Pant on stump mic for Bavuma goes viral Jasprit Bumrah's chat with Rishabh Pant about Temba Bavuma's height has gone viral. The incident occurred in the 13th over when Bumrah thought he had trapped the Proteas skipper in front of the stumps.

Watch: Ex-Spanish football chief Luis Rubiales pelted with eggs during book launch Luis Rubiales' book launch in Madrid turned chaotic when his uncle threw eggs at him, adding drama to a year marked by his conviction for the non-consensual kiss on Jenni Hermoso and a sweeping scandal that reshaped Spanish football.

On Paris attacks anniversary, France restrict World Cup qualification celebrations France qualified for the 2026 World Cup after a 4-0 victory over Ukraine, but the team kept post-match celebrations minimal in recognition of the 10th anniversary of the November 13, 2015 attacks in Paris.

End of the road for Sai Sudharsan? No.3 spot can't be a musical chairs game, says Chopra Aakash Chopra has slammed the decision to drop Sai Sudharsan from the playing XI for the Kolkata Test. Sudharsan was dropped from the game despite scoring an impressive 87 in the second Test against the West Indies.

Shubman Gill laughs off toss woes, says he's saving his luck for the WTC finalIND vs SA, 1st Test Day 1: Shubman Gill brushed off another lost toss with a WTC final quip but said India's 'very hungry' Test side is ready for a strong start in South Africa, banking on early movement for pacers and key changes in the XI.

1st Test: No Rabada for SA; Axar, Pant return as India go with four spinnersA fit-again Rishabh Pant, who had suffered an injury in England in July, replaced all-rounder Nitish Kumar Reddy, while Axar Patel was back inside in place of Sai Sudharsan in the playing XI as India opted to go with four spinners.

How Ronaldo could miss World Cup opener after first Portugal red card in 22 yearsCristiano Ronaldo risks missing Portugal's World Cup opener after receiving the first red card of his international career in his 226th appearance. The dismissal in a crucial qualifier against the Republic of Ireland could lead to a multi-match ban.

Be honest with Mohammed Shami: Pujara tells BCCI to give selection clarity to pacerCheteshwar Pujara has urged the selectors and the Indian team management to be honest with Mohammed Shami about his future with the national team. Shami has been forced to remain on the sidelines with him last playing a Test in 2023.

Pakistan military chief helped salvage Sri Lanka tri-nation series: Mohsin NaqviPakistan's interior minister, Mohsin Naqvi, said on Thursday that army chief General Asim Munir personally intervened to salvage the Sri Lankan cricket team's tour after the suicide attack in Islamabad.

IPL 2026 retention prediction: Are SRH ready to move on from Heinrich Klaasen?Sunrisers Hyderabad head into the IPL 2026 mini-auction with their biggest decision revolving around Heinrich Klaasen's hefty Rs 23-crore contract. Releasing him could free up vital purse space and reshape the franchise's entire rebuilding strategy.

Rajasthan Royals 2026 retentions: Another reset, another crossroadsRajasthan Royals stand at another crossroads. With Sanju Samson's future uncertain and a rebuild looming, the 2026 auction could define the franchise's identity. The question now: will RR finally commit to a clear direction?

Varun Chakravarthy named Tamil Nadu captain for Syed Mushtaq Ali TrophyVarun Chakravarthy has been appointed captain of Tamil Nadu for this season's Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. They begin their campaign against Rajasthan on November 26 in Ahmedabad.

Agra welcome home World Cup star Deepti Sharma with 10 km roadshowAgra turned out in huge numbers to welcome home Deepti Sharma after India's historic Women's World Cup win. The all-rounder received a 10km roadshow celebration as the city honoured her tournament-defining performances.

South Africa must frustrate Rishabh Pant and play on his emotions: Mark BoucherMark Boucher has advised South Africa to counter Rishabh Pant's aggressive batting by playing on his ego and employing strategic field placements in the upcoming Test series against India. Pant will be making a comeback to international cricket after four months having recently recovered from a toe fracture sustained in England.

Sports Minister urges dialogue as I-League clubs seek solution to AIFF–ISL deadlockSports Minister Mansukh Mandaviya has stepped in as Indian football's crisis deepens, meeting I-League representatives to hear their concerns. He has urged AIFF, ISL and I-League stakeholders to begin constructive dialogue immediately.

IPL 2026 retention prediction: Can RCB strengthen their Hazlewood-reliant pace attack?RCB's title-winning formula revolved around Josh Hazlewood's brilliance and Rajat Patidar's leadership. As they prepare for IPL 2026, the defending champions must expand their pace depth and find support for their Australian spearhead.

IND vs SA 1st Test Predicted XI: Will India field spin trio of Axar, Kuldeep, Washington?India face a genuine selection dilemma ahead of the first Test, with Shubman Gill admitting uncertainty over the bowling balance. The Eden Gardens surface has kept the door open for both a three-spinner and three-seamer combination.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
